Package org.puremvc.java.multicore.utilities.pipes.plumbing

Class Junction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.puremvc.java.multicore.utilities.pipes.plumbing.Junction
  • public class Junction
extends java.lang.Object

    Pipe Junction.

    Manages Pipes for a Module.

    When you register a Pipe with a Junction, it is declared as being an INPUT pipe or an OUTPUT pipe.

    You can retrieve or remove a registered Pipe by name, check to see if a Pipe with a given name exists,or if it exists AND is an INPUT or an OUTPUT Pipe.

    You can send an IPipeMessage on a named INPUT Pipe or add a PipeListener to registered INPUT Pipe.

    • Method Detail

      • registerPipe

        public boolean registerPipe​(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String type,
                            IPipeFitting pipe)

        Register a pipe with the junction.

        Pipes are registered by unique name and type, which must be either Junction.INPUT or Junction.OUTPUT.

        NOTE: You cannot have an INPUT pipe and an OUTPUT pipe registered with the same name. All pipe names must be unique regardless of type.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the pipe
        type - type of the pipe
        pipe - pipe fitting
        Returns:
        Boolean true if successfully registered. false if another pipe exists by that name.

      • hasPipe

        public boolean hasPipe​(java.lang.String name)

        Does this junction have a pipe by this name?

        Parameters:
        name - the pipe to check for
        Returns:
        whether as pipe is registered with that name.

      • hasInputPipe

        public boolean hasInputPipe​(java.lang.String name)

        Does this junction have an INPUT pipe by this name?

        Parameters:
        name - the pipe to check for
        Returns:
        whether an INPUT pipe is registered with that name.

      • hasOutputPipe

        public boolean hasOutputPipe​(java.lang.String name)

        Does this junction have an OUTPUT pipe by this name?

        Parameters:
        name - the pipe to check for
        Returns:
        whether an OUTPUT pipe is registered with that name.

      • removePipe

        public void removePipe​(java.lang.String name)

        Remove the pipe with this name if it is registered.

        NOTE: You cannot have an INPUT pipe and an OUTPUT pipe registered with the same name. All pipe names must be unique regardless of type.

        Parameters:
        name - the pipe to remove

      • retrievePipe

        public IPipeFitting retrievePipe​(java.lang.String name)

        Retrieve the named pipe.

        Parameters:
        name - the pipe to retrieve
        Returns:
        IPipeFitting the pipe registered by the given name if it exists

      • addPipeListener

        public boolean addPipeListener​(java.lang.String inputPipeName,
                               java.lang.Object context,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<IPipeMessage> listener)

        Add a PipeListener to an INPUT pipe.

        NOTE: there can only be one PipeListener per pipe, and the listener function must accept an IPipeMessage as its sole argument.

        Parameters:
        inputPipeName - the INPUT pipe to add a PipeListener to
        context - the calling context or 'this' object
        listener - the function on the context to call
        Returns:
        true if listener connection was successful

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage​(java.lang.String outputPipeName,
                           IPipeMessage message)

        Send a message on an OUTPUT pipe.

        Parameters:
        outputPipeName - the OUTPUT pipe to send the message on
        message - the IPipeMessage to send
        Returns:
        true if message was successfully written to the named pipe
